channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Yelp makes it easier to support Asian-owned businesses
item.description: Yelp is making it easier to support Asian-owned businesses with an opt-in label that identifies restaurants and shops.

item.title: Sonos Roam review: The right speaker at the right price
item.description: The Sonos Roam is a slim, light, $170 speaker that competes directly with Bluetooth-enabled devices like the Ultimate Ears Boom and Megaboom options. Despite its small size and lower price tag, though, the Roam has a lot more features on board than the average Bluetooth speaker. And that might make it enticing â€” especially if you already own other Sonos devices.

item.title: Fender's Mustang Micro packs impressive amp modelling in a tiny package
item.description: Fender brings its amp modeling chops to a headphone guitar amp.

item.title: The Apple Watch Series 6 is down to $320 on Amazon
item.description: Amazon is selling the Apple Watch Series 6 Product Red edition smartwatch at an all-time low price of $320.

item.title: TikTok is finally adding automatic captions
item.description: TikTok is taking a big step toward making its app more accessible: the app is adding automatic captions, which allows video makers to create subtitles for their clips.

item.title: The Morning After: Federal labor regulators say Amazon illegally fired two employees
item.description: Today's headlines: Yahoo Answers is shutting down on May 4th, Federal labor agency says Amazon illegally fired climate activists and someone made a playable, TV-sized Nintendo Switch.

item.title: Apple's 128GB 10.2-inch iPad is back to an all-time low at Best Buy
item.description: The 128GB 10-inch iPad is back to $380 on Best Buy, $50 less than its original price of $430.

item.title: Google's Pixel 5 April update appears to boost GPU performance
item.description: Google's Pixel 5 flagship phone has reportedly witnessed a massive improvement in GPU performance following an April security update.

item.title: Sony's LED Bravia TVs with 'cognitive intelligence' start at $1,299
item.description: Sony has unveiled its first LED models with the Cognitive Processor XR that are more reasonably priced than the OLED models.

item.title: Google's latest acquisition could lead to spatial audio for the Pixel Buds
item.description: Google recently acquired a 3D audio startup that could lead to new features for the Pixel Buds or any of its other future products.

item.title: The next Apple TV may support 4K 120Hz gaming
item.description: The next Apple TV model might support 120Hz refresh rates, presumably at 4K.

item.title: Clubhouse teams up with Stripe so anybody can send creators money
item.description: Clubhouse has teamed up with Stripe to introduce Clubhouse Payments, which gives all users a way to send money directly to speakers on the platform.

item.title: What's on TV this week: 'Them,' 'Thunder Force' and 'Republic Commando'
item.description: This week Netflix premieres a new superhero flick with Melissa McCarthy and a Dolly Parton tribute.

item.title: Facebook's line of PC-only VR headsets ends as Rift S stock dries up
item.description: The Oculus Rift S stock is drying up and Facebook says it won't be replenished as it focuses on standalone VR headsets.

item.title: Discord banned 2,212 servers for extremist content in the second half of 2020
item.description: Discord also deleted 30,000 accounts for promoting violent or extremist content.

item.title: Season two of 'Star Trek: Lower Decks' hits Paramount+ on August 12th
item.description: Animated comedy 'Star Trek: Lower Decks' gets a second season on Paramount+ this summer.

item.title: The new season of 'Star Trek: Discovery' debuts later this year
item.description: 'Star Trek: Discovery' season four will debut later this year on Paramount+.

item.title: Yahoo Answers is shutting down on May 4th
item.description: Pour one out for one of the web's oldest Q&A websites.

item.title: Democratic lawmakers ask Facebook to detail its Instagram for kids project
item.description: A group of four Democratic lawmakers says they're concerned with the company's plan to build an Instagram for users under the age of 13.

item.title: 'Star Trek: Picard' season two will debut on Paramount+ in 2022
item.description: 'Star Trek: Picard' season 2 will debut in 2022 with an old frenemy in tow.

item.title: Zoom now works on Amazon's Echo Show 10
item.description: Amazon Chime is also available on the smart display.

item.title: Someone made a playable, TV-sized Nintendo Switch
item.description: This Switch comes in at 30 inches tall and 70 inches wide, making it impossible to touch two buttons on opposite sides of one another without stretching out as far as you can.

item.title: Google opens up the Play Store to more Android Auto apps
item.description: Android Auto users will soon see a greater variety of navigation, parking and charging apps on the Play Store.

item.title: Supreme Court vacates ruling that prevented Trump from blocking Twitter critics
item.description: Not that it matters too much for Trump anyway after Twitter permanently banned him.

item.title: TP-Link's latest WiFi 6 router packs 4.8Gbps speeds at a reasonable price
item.description: TP-Link has introduced the Archer AX5400, a WiFi 6 router that promises 4.8Gbps connections at a semi-affordable price.
